snippet: The action in the Mong Kok district came after the police had previously moved to greatly shrink the area occupied and barricaded by protesters in two other areas, Admiralty and Causeway Bay.
abstract: Hundreds of Hong Kong police officers begin surprise raid to remove many of barricades erected by pro-democracy students and other protesters in Mong Kok district; police had previously moved to greatly shrink the area occupied and barricaded by protesters in two other areas, Admiralty and Causeway Bay.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and ALAN WONG

lead_paragraph: The action in the Mong Kok district came after the police had previously moved to greatly shrink the area occupied and barricaded by protesters in two other areas, Admiralty and Causeway Bay.

headline.main: Police Raid Removes Many of Protesters’ Barricades
headline.print_headline: Police Raid Removes Many of Protesters’ Barricades
